content: The following lists events that happened during **1972 in Singapore**. ## Incumbents - [President](/wiki/President_of_Singapore): [Benjamin Henry Sheares](/wiki/Benjamin_Henry_Sheares) - [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore): [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) ## Events ### January - 1 January – The [Post Office Savings Bank](/wiki/POSB_Bank) is turned into a [statutory board](/wiki/Statutory_boards_of_the_Singapore_Government). This allows the bank more freedom to run its operations. ### February - 7 February – The National Wages Council is set up to ensure sustainable wages. This comes after wages have risen quickly the previous year. ### April - 1 April – The Telephone Department is converted into a statutory board called the Telecommunication Authority of Singapore. - 2 April – The [Singapore Grand Prix](/wiki/Singapore_Grand_Prix) is won by [Max Stewart](/wiki/Max_Stewart). ### May - 12 May – The National Productivity Board is formed to encourage productivity. ### June - 15 June – The SAF Act comes into effect, allowing for effective management of the [Singapore Armed Forces](/wiki/Singapore_Armed_Forces). The Act merges the air, sea and land vocations and establishes the Armed Forces Council. ### July - 2 July – [Singapore Armed Forces Reservist Association](/wiki/SAFRA_National_Service_Association) is officially launched. - 20 July – The [Stop at Two](/wiki/Population_planning_in_Singapore#Stop-at-Two) policy is unveiled to encourage people to have smaller families. ### August - 17 August – Work starts on the [Brani Naval Base](/wiki/Brani_Naval_Base). ### September - 1 September – The [Sentosa Development Corporation](/wiki/Sentosa_Development_Corporation) is formed to manage [Sentosa](/wiki/Sentosa) and the outlying islands to attract tourists. - 2 September – The [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) wins the [1972 General Election](/wiki/1972_Singapore_general_election). - 15 September – The first [Merlion Park](/wiki/Waterboat_House_Garden) is officially opened. - 18 September – 22-year-old Chan Chee Chan is [shot dead](/wiki/1972_Queenstown_shooting) while walking through Queenstown; the crime remains unsolved. ### October - 1 October – [Singapore Airlines](/wiki/Singapore_Airlines) starts its first flights. - 13 October – Heavy fog, an environmental phenomenon that had built up since the beginning of the month, causes gridlock and other problems throughout Singapore. - 24 October – Disincentives are announced to nudge families into having only two children, taking effect on 1 August 1973. Among them are progressive reduction of income tax relief to the first three children; increase in childbirth fees depending on births; reduction of paid maternity leave from three to two confinements; and lowering priority of HDB flats allocations for large families (more than two children). ### November - 21 November – [A fire engulfs](/wiki/1972_Robinsons_department_store_fire) the [Robinson's Department Store](/wiki/Robinsons_%26_Co.), causing 9 deaths. In addition, the impact of the fire damaged the roof of the [Overseas Union Bank](/wiki/Overseas_Union_Bank) building and forced the Stock Exchange to stop trading for the day. As a result, this makes the fire one of the worst in Singapore's history. ### December - 15 December - - [OCBC](/wiki/OCBC_Bank) acquires Four Seas Communications Bank. - [SATS Ltd](/wiki/SATS_Ltd) is established as a separate company from [Singapore Airlines](/wiki/Singapore_Airlines) to manage ground operations and inflight catering services. ### Date unknown - The OG building is officially opened. - Three Rifles Holdings is founded, becoming a company selling clothes. - [Specialists' Shopping Centre](/wiki/Specialists%27_Shopping_Centre) is opened in [Orchard Road](/wiki/Orchard_Road). It has since been demolished. - The first [Guardian](/wiki/Guardian_Pharmacy) store is opened by [Cold Storage](/wiki/Cold_Storage_(supermarket)). - [Shaw Centre](/wiki/Shaw_House_and_Centre#Shaw_Centre) is opened. ## Births - 22 February – [Dasmond Koh](/wiki/Dasmond_Koh), actor. - 26 April – [Diana Ser](/wiki/Diana_Ser), journalist, media personality. - 27 May – [Lynn Ban](/wiki/Lynn_Ban), jewellery designer (died 2025) - 15 September – [Kit Chan](/wiki/Kit_Chan), singer. - 30 September – [Darren Lim](/wiki/Darren_Lim), actor. - 6 November – [Janil Puthucheary](/wiki/Janil_Puthucheary), politician. - 18 December – [Lawrence Wong](/wiki/Lawrence_Wong), [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_(Singapore)). - [Alvin Pang](/wiki/Alvin_Pang) - poet. ## Deaths - 4 April – Lionel Chan – racing driver, 28 (injuries sustained in a crash during the Singapore Grand Prix) - 5 May – [Chen Su Lan](/wiki/Chen_Su_Lan) – one of Singapore's first local medical graduates, philanthropist, social reformer (b. 1885). - 5 September – [Bashir Ahmad Mallal](/wiki/Bashir_Ahmad_Mallal) – founder of Malayan Law Journal (b. 1898). - 11 September – [Tan Lark Sye](/wiki/Tan_Lark_Sye) – former chairman of the [Singapore Hokkien Huay Kuan](/wiki/Singapore_Hokkien_Huay_Kuan) and founder of the [Nanyang University](/wiki/Nanyang_University) (b. 1897). This Singapore-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: 1972 in Singapore
